result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian Leonard Bos
Current: 2690 160th Ave, Emerald, WI 54013 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2022)
Prior: 2690 160th Avenue, Apt 34, Emerald, WI 54013
Arraignment on April 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus   DF:  Brian Leonard Bos appeared from jail. Case called at 2:31 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. ADA Smestad represented DE back in 2006 on a Dunn County matter. Court will recess at 2:33 p.m. for DE to speak to his attorney. Case recalled at 2:37 p.m. Atty Firkus states after speaking to client, will continue with the hearing with ADA Smestad. Court reviews rights with DE. DE understand. Court finds DE freely and knowingly waives any potential conflict with ADA Smestad. ADA Smestad calls Investigator O'Keefe to the Stand. S/T Michael O'Keefe. Employed with the St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA Smestad. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Witness excused. No further evidence or witnesses by either party. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court schedules for arraignment. Court adjourned at 2:46 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Firkus. km
22R 004877. $5000 posted by Brittany S. cah
Filed by DA's Office. km
Preliminary hearing on April 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing random ETG testing at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  K.S.H, T.J.C. or the location of 1489 290th St in Glenwood Township.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Brian Leonard Bos appeared from jail via video. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Qualifies for PD services. Atty Dolfi states Atty Firkus is appointed on other files. Will see if he will accept appointment. Court schedules for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
